item.title: Breaking Barriers: A Strategic Framework for Collaborative Governance in Software
item.description: Collaborative governance in software is challenging. This presentation focuses on stakeholder participation which seems limited to those with the technical acumen, tooling expertise, and positions of influence. Yet, evidence shows that great collaboration is dependent on quality divergent thinking balanced with quality convergent thinking. This presentation lays out a strategic framework that curates broader participation by leveraging a landscape of networks and communication channels. Governance in software development tends to exclude valuable insights from individuals outside the technical sphere.
